text:
When checking out by revision label, additional project folders will be created 
even if they are not part of the label.

This may also happen for view labels, but I have not tested that case.  I 
suggest you test that case out too.

Example:

   <target name="checkout_scripts_label" depends="init" if="starteam.bmo.label">
      <stcheckout URL="${starteam.ps.url}" username="${starteam.user}" 
password="${starteam.password}" userepositorytimestamp="true"
         rootlocalfolder="${scripts}" rootstarteamfolder="tst/scripts" 
forced="true" label="${starteam.tst.label}"/>
   </target>

When running this target with a starteam.tst.label of "dummy" for a revision 
label created on a single file called dummy.txt, all subfolders and their 
children in the tst/scripts were created as well, even if they didn't have that 
revision label.  The created subfolders were empty.
creator: blakesys@yahoo.com

creator: stevec@ignitesports.com

text: OK, this is now fixed. COMMITTER - please use only the last patch - the one dated 11/09/02 06:00 The others are bad. (Would be nice to be able to delete them if you put them there). Fix is as follows - when checking out to a revision label, directories are never created unless needed. This is regardless of the createworkingdirs attribute, which if the user set true, is ignored, with a warning message. This is because only FILES are part of revision labels, not folders. when checking out to something other than a revision label, whether or not directories are created for empty dirs is controlled by the createworkingdirs attribute, as indicated in the documentation, but which did not work correctly before.
creator: stevec@ignitesports.com

text: Why do you say it's not fixed?  The 11/09/02 06:00 patch does fix the problem.
creator: stevec@ignitesports.com

text:
Ah, now I see why you marked it as not fixed.  Thanks for the email, Stefan. 
It's only fixed when you commit it.  Fix it with 11/09/02 06:00 patch.

It's been over two months.  I'll repeat my last comment.  Can we PLEASE get this
committed?

I've applied this path to CVS HEAD without issues. I cannot easily mereg across
the changes to th 1.5 branch since the patch makes changes to code not in the
1.5 branch (epecifically enhancements 14006,14208,14210). If you want this fix
in for 1.5.2, can you generate a separate patch for the 1.5 branch and reopen,
otherwise this will be included in 1.6
